Science and technology for development
​The ITU Secretary-General addressed the 28th session of the Commission on Science and Technology for Development.
Read the speech​​








Standards needed for trustworthy AI
​As artificial intelligence motors ahead, technical standards can safeguard human rights and ensure AI benefits everyone, says ITU's Deputy Secretary-General Tomas Lamanuaskas.
Read the blog​








Space Connect: Updating LEO satellite regulations
​Low Earth orbit (LEO) constellations offer fast two-way communications and broader coverage than traditional geostationary satellites. Regulators must adapt.
Learn more from our expert panel
   
 ​








Advancing quantum technology
​​A new Quantum for Good track is set to be part of the AI for Good Global Summit on 8-11 July in Geneva, Switzerland.Read the blog​​​



















Machine translation by ITU Translate. See 
   full disclaimer. Provide 
   feedback.​​

Closing the early warning gap​​​










Dangers of satellite spoofing and jamming​​​










Young women in digital – apply 6 April!​​​









In depth​​​














​​​​ITU Journal shares new research on geospatial AI​​​​​​










​
   ​ITU Radio Regulations (2024) in effect 1 January 2025​​​
